s.text: But he's trying to avoid the opposite note--"the people agree with me, so I must be right."
But he's trying to avoid the opposite note--"the people agree with me, so I must be right."
His defense (for which K had contempt at the time) was that he intended to mislead but was technically telling the truth.
So the strong tendency of Democrats and Republicans to see Flytrap differently is especially impressive.

"The Beast stands for strong, mutually antagonistic governments everywhere," says the press magnate, Lord Copper, in Evelyn Waugh's Scoop . That is a pretty good attitude to have about domestic politics.
This was a note K used to strike a lot in the 1980s, and he's glad he doesn't have to strike it anymore.
This was a note K used to strike a lot in the 1980s, and he's glad he doesn't have to strike it anymore.
But unthinking partisanship can strike anyone at any time.
These days, though, the polls show that people pretty clearly don't want President Clinton impeached.
These days, though, the polls show that people pretty clearly don't want President Clinton impeached.
As K was thinking this through, though, the line of reasoning started to seem familiar.
As K was thinking this through, though, the line of reasoning started to seem familiar.
